page.title: 08Illston - Blacksmith cont.
page.content: There are further examinations if one wants to become a Master Farrier. The fuel farriers use is called "blacksmith's breeze" - a special type of washed coke which will burn cleanly without smoking or spitting. The shoes are made of mild steel and this is bought into the forge in 18-22 feet lengths. A shoe on a horse will last anything from 10 days to 6 weeks, depending on the horse, the rider and the type of use it has. After the 6 weeks have passed the hooves have usually grown and the horse will need re-shoeing whether the shoe has worn down or not. The old shoes are used as scrap metal and sold to a dealer. The charge to customers for having a horse shod is around Â£24 if Mr. Deacon has to travel out.
